intro: Aldama meridionalis, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms during the spring and summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
